CLand is a Convergence Institute funded by the French government in 2017 to perform in the next decade the research urgently needed on land-management solutions for managing the ecological and energy transitions of the 21st century.

CLand develops new cross-disciplinary research across leading teams in the Paris area in modelling climate change, food and fibre production, biodiversity dynamics, ecosystem functioning and land-use socio-economics. In addition to models, data syntheses will help understand key feedbacks and assess risks and sustainable options for integrated management of land ecosystems.

CLand aims to support the activity of 200 researchers in 12 teams, and to develop a graduate programme across Master and Doctoral schools of the University of Paris Saclay, in partnership with European and international institutes.

Cooking is¬†the art, science, and craft of using heat (or other methods) to prepare food, transforming raw ingredients into palatable, digestible, nutritious, and safe meals.¬†

Here's a more detailed explanation:

Definition:

Cooking involves applying heat or other methods (like cold storage or fermentation) to food to make it edible and/or more appealing.¬†

Purpose:

Cooking enhances the flavor, texture, and digestibility of food, and it also helps to kill harmful bacteria and parasites, making food safer to eat.¬†

Methods:

There are many different cooking methods, including baking, roasting, frying, grilling, boiling, steaming, and braising.¬†

Culinary Arts:

Cooking is often considered an art, as it involves creativity, skill, and the ability to combine ingredients in unique and delicious ways.¬†

Scientific Basis:

Cooking also has a strong scientific basis, as it involves understanding the chemical and physical changes that occur in food when it is heated or treated in other ways

Il y a des gestes techniques dans le processus productif qui sont de moins en moins usit√©s car ils privil√©gient le qualitatif au quantitatif. Pourtant, dans une perspective qualitative, il y a des gestes, des op√©rations, des comp√©tences qui m√©ritent qu‚Äôon ne les oublie pas. Ils constituent tr√®s souvent des plus values int√©ressantes pour ceux qui les ma√Ætrisent encore. BEST4SOIL - A NETWORK OF PRACTIONERS, FOR SHARING KNOWLEDGE ON PREVENTION AND REDUCTION OF SOIL BORNE DISEASES

Healthy soils are of major importance for the future of the European horticultural and agricultural crop production. Especially in intensive production systems, soil borne diseases are a major factor with a negative impact on soil health. Newly developed best practices and sound crop rotations permit to maintain, improve or re-establish soil health in Europe.

With Best4Soil we are building a community of practice network across Europe by inter-connecting growers, advisers, educators and researchers. This network promotes knowledge ready for practice on 4 best practices.

For more information please visit: https://www.best4soil.eu

Best4Soil has received funding from the European Union‚Äôs Horizon 2020 Programme as Coordination and Support Action, under GA n¬∞ 817696.

The Off Grid Project started out as a live in experiment about getting off the grid on a budget. Since then, back in 2012, it has evolved into a daily vlog of my life, sort of an off grid reality show.

I started out full time when I lost my job and apartment and moved into a camper during a blizzard. I barely had any light or heat. I started making daily videos and never looked back on the rat race.

Now I am married and living on an 18 acre homestead with my wife Melanie. We are striving to become self sufficient and fully off the grid on a budget. We hunt, fish, raise chickens and grow our own vegetables for food. We have solar panels, wind turbines and alternate energy devices.

Follow along on our daily path as we strive to become self sufficient and provide all our own needs. We study the old ways, buy second hand and build whatever we need to provide for ourselves.

https://www.thedoityourselfworld.com
https://www.theoffgridproject.com

About AfricaRice

AfricaRice is a CGIAR Research Center ‚Äì part of a global research partnership for a food-secure future. It is also an intergovernmental association of African member countries. 

The Center was created in 1971 by 11 African countries. Today its membership comprises 26 countries, covering West, Central, East and North African regions, namely Benin, Burkina Faso, Cameroon, Central African Republic, Chad, C√¥te d‚ÄôIvoire, Democratic Republic of Congo, Egypt, Ethiopia, Gabon, the Gambia, Ghana, Guinea, Guinea Bissau, Liberia, Madagascar, Mali, Mauritania, Niger, Nigeria, Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Senegal, Sierra Leone, Togo and Uganda.

The Rural Water Supply Network (RWSN) is the global network for rural water supply professionals, with 10,000 members in more than 150 countries.

RWSN is a strategic global platform for knowledge sharing and collaboration in the water sector with a central focus on the achievement of universal access to safe, affordable water supplies. Because 4 out of 5 of those without access to an improved water source live in rural areas, the ambitious Sustainable Development Goal 6 and the legal duties under the Human Right to Water can only be achieved through strong partnerships at all levels from local to global.

RWSN‚Äôs vision is of a world in which all rural people have access to sustainable and reliable water supplies which can be effectively managed to provide sufficient, affordable and safe water within a reasonable distance of the home.

In 2016 my wife and I decided to invest in our research (aquaponics, anaerobic digester, solar, and wind power) of over 5 years and start to build the first prototype of a self sustainable, arduino automated, agriculture system that will provide food and energy to ourselves and our local community. My name is Balloux. Yeah like the bear in the jungle book (almost the same spelling)... He is said to be a cheerful, laid-back character and that he likes to have fun... I think this description matches perfectly to me üòÅ
I am 25, I got my degree as a graphic designer 3 years ago.

And I had the opportunity to leave in Laos (the country where my father was born) at this time.
I spent 8 months there; I have traveled, I have worked in this country and I have begun to speak lao.

This was a true revelation for me : new culture , new climate ,new way of life, another way of thinking

Traveling by car, hitchiking, train, motorbike, bus or unicorn.

Sleeping in the wild, home stay or hostel.

Working, voluntering...

Stopping infront of landscapes and atypical places. Always with my drone.
Trying to get closer to people.

Yara grows knowledge to responsibly feed the world and protect the planet. Supporting our vision of a world without hunger and a planet respected, we pursue a strategy of sustainable value growth, promoting climate-friendly crop nutrition and zero-emission energy solutions.

Through our focus on clean ammonia production, we aim to enable the hydrogen economy, driving a green transition of shipping, fertilizer production and other energy intensive industries.

Founded in 1905 to solve the emerging famine in Europe, Yara has established a unique position as the industry‚Äôs only global crop nutrition company. We operate an integrated business model with around 17,000 employees and operations in over 60 countries.

Discover and enjoy these quicker and easier ways of growing and harvesting vegetables, based on my 42 years of growing experience. 

My speciality is the no dig method, suitable for all soils. It results in fewer weeds, and vegetables plus flowers grow as well if not better than when soil is tilled or dug. And it's good for climate change because no soil carbon is lost in tillage.

Decades of trialling methods and sowing dates have led me to a fine knowledge of best practice, in time-saving ways. My advice in these videos brings you harvests and pleasure in equal measure.

I wish you success in growing and want these tips to be more widely available, so that everyone who wants to grow great food can do so, without unnecessary work.

I moved alone, to a cabin in the woods, 800+ days ago to heal from a really hard period of my life. I am working on my mental heath, learning new self care skills, teaching myself how how to build, & most importantly I am here to grow & find happiness. I'm 35 & my name is Lorenzo!

nom_chaine: That's What We Call The Good Life
bio:
We have created this UK gardening YouTube channel to share what we do to live what we call the good life.

We are passionate about growing your own food. We have an allotment as well as a back garden. We keep chickens as well as grow a variety of vegetables and enjoy enjoy eating seasonal fruit and vegetables.

We will be sharing some of our favourite recipes on here. We like to demonstrate that eating well doesn't have to be complicated, difficult expensive. We enjoy eating a variety of good food and treats. We believe that if more people did this then we could together reduce food waste and plastics.

Please join us and subscribe to our channel. You can help us if you suggest new video topics and share our videos. If we can all live a little more sustainably and encourage a few others to do the same, together we will make a difference.

Hello, I'm Sara. I'm a Dutch self-taught videomaker. Through my skills, I want to provide a platform for sustainable projects. We live in a world where sustainability is fortunately becoming increasingly important. Through my videos, I want to raise awareness of different ways of living.

In the coming year, I'll be traveling across Europe, visiting various Workaway locations. Workaway is a website where travelers like me can work with companies or families of their choice. I choose to visit farms that strive to have as little impact on the earth as possible. I will also visit families living off-grid and aiming to be as self-sufficient as possible. During my stay, I will work as a volunteer in their lifestyle so that I can share an authentic portrayal with the world. I hope to inspire and educate people through these videos.

Building resilience, sustainable meat, and sovereign individuals one rabbit at a time! 

Rabbit meat is nutrient dense, sustainable, and easy to grow on a small scale. West Meadow Rabbits is here to help you understand everything that goes into producing meat rabbits, and how you can get started with them. 

Meat rabbits are the solution to many of the problems facing us today. I believe that they can even change the world. I professionally breed New Zealand Red rabbits with the goal of producing animals that look great, and produce meat efficiently to help make this a reality. The content on this channel is based on my years of experience and has the beginner in mind.  There are many ways to do things, but my goal is to ensure your success. 

Please explore the channel and if you have any questions, ideas, comments or requests, let me know! 

Sam

Teach Engineering is a FREE digital library comprised of hundreds of standards-aligned, design-rich, engineering curricula for K-12 educators to make science and math come alive through design thinking. 

Teach Engineering was founded more than 20 years ago and is consistently expanding with the help of university engineering faculty, graduate students, and K-12 teachers across the nations. We have developed more than 500 lessons with over 1,300 hands-on activities and maker challenges. Our collection aligns with state and/or national science, mathematics and technology educational standards, and uses engineering as the vehicle to integrate science and mathematics concepts for K-12 students.

In the summer of 2017, we decided to expand our reach by adding brief, instructional videos of some of our activities. Our goal is to promote our collection to help make teaching science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) easy and accessible for K-12 educators everywhere.

Hi my name is Jeff and I have a passion for local native plants and growing my own food. 

I'm trained in conservation and land management and have worked in bush regeneration and re-vegetation in both a professional sense and on a volunteer basis for over 5 years. I run my own business which specialises in natural areas restoration and growing local plants. Here on the NSW South Coast we have exceptionally beautiful landscapes and some truly unique flora and ecological communities and I want to do everything I can to help preserve our natural world.

This channel is a way for me to share my passion for growing native plants, vegetables and natural areas management. I have a bunch of interests in the field and this is a place for me to be creative and share my knowledge of conservation and gardening with a wider audience.

I hope you'll find some interesting content here on my channel.

Capturing the natural beauty of chemistry

I find that chemistry is often taught poorly or without a purpose. Because of this, people tend to lose interest and sometimes even start to hate it. In each video that I make, I try to balance theory with purpose. My goal is to capture the natural beauty of chemistry in fun and interesting ways.

In terms of education, I have a BSc in Biochemistry, with a minor in pharmacology. However, I've always been a lot more drawn to applied chemistry. So after finishing my degree, I worked as a lab tech in an organic lab, and then as a chemistry grad student. However, I ended up leaving my graduate studies early to focus on this channel. Now, making chemistry videos has become my full-time job!

Hi guys, I am Alex.

I am an Ukrainian expat who moved to Portugal.

No one in my family ever did any farming, But I discovered that I am very passionate about farming so recently I decided to leave the rat race, So I've purchased this 28 hectares Farm in Central Portugal, with the intention to start a small scale farm raising worms, cows and sheep.

In this little farm I am also planning to build an off-grid home, and be as self sufficient as possible, by growing my own food.

I created this channel to share my journey with the world,  The journey of a first generation farmer, that is starting with no prior knowledge and experiences.
That maybe all the mistakes that I will make along this journey, and all the fails maybe will help some of you to learn from my mistake and not make them yourself.
I want to bring value and inspire people who are thinking about farming.

I am not a filmmaker or an editor, I am just a simple guy with a camera.

Driven by the vision that everyone needs a decent place to live, Habitat for Humanity found its earliest inspirations as a grassroots movement on an interracial community farm in south Georgia. Since its founding in 1976, the Christian housing organization has since grown to become a leading global nonprofit working in local communities across all 50 states in the U.S. and in more than 70 countries. Families and individuals in need of a hand up partner with Habitat for Humanity to build or improve a place they can call home. Habitat homeowners help build their own homes alongside volunteers and pay an affordable mortgage. Through financial support, volunteering or adding a voice to support affordable housing, everyone can help families achieve the strength, stability and self-reliance they need to build better lives for themselves. Through shelter, we empower. To learn more, visit habitat.org.

nom_chaine: Cloudberry Flowers - Flower Farm and Garden
bio:
Hi, my name is Catherine and I am a flower grower based in the Scotland in the UK. I have been growing cut flowers on my flower farm in Scotland since 2015. We are in zone 8b and usually have our last frost at the end of May and our first frost mid October, although it can be as early as September or more unusually early November. 

We are located in a small Scottish town, with 1 acre of land. Unusually for the size of garden we are just a few minutes walk from the high street. I started growing 8 years ago and provide flowers to local customers and florists. It's been an exciting self taught adventure with many a success and disaster! Flower growing and gardening will always be an opportunity for learning and through my videos I hope I can share with you some of my successes, failures and my love of flowers each week. I would love it if you wanted to follow along with my flower farming journey, Catherine x

Bonjour, nous avons choisi d'√™tre autonome sur notre terrain. Produire notre nourriture v√©g√©tarienne bien s√ªr ! 
Car nous respectons toute forme de vie quelque soit son apparence :  les animaux, les arbres, les humains et les plantes. 
Bien sur vous allez dire : les v√©g√©taux sont mang√©s aussi ??

Hey there! I'm Emma, and welcome to my frugal living channel. Here, I share my tips and tricks for living a fulfilling life while being mindful of our spending habits.

As someone who used to live paycheck to paycheck, I understand the importance of being frugal without sacrificing quality of life. That's why I started this channel - to help others who may be in a similar situation.

On this channel, you'll find videos on everything from budgeting and meal planning to DIY projects and travel hacks. I truly believe that being frugal doesn't mean missing out on the things we love - it just means finding creative ways to enjoy them.

So join me on this journey towards financial freedom and a more intentional lifestyle. Let's learn and grow together!

Thanks for reading,
Emma

We are two humans, Diamond and Leah, who no longer support the inhuman, oligarchic empire model destroying our planet and our true nature as human beings. As activists we decided to do something about it, so we opted out of our former lives to begin anew. We are currently transforming alpine desert wilderness into a self-sustaining homestead and organic farm in preparation for the upcoming collapse. We present every step of our implementation in open source format for the benefit of all humanity. With our backgrounds in academia and the sciences (climatology, geology, philosophy of science, physics, and more) we aim to uncover the lies perpetrated by the mass media. Keep up with our progress by subscribing to the channel, visiting our Facebook, Patreon or following us on Twitter. If you're curious about the name, interested in homesteading, permaculture, or just want to know what the heck earthships or grand solar mininums are, check out our website (https://www.oppenheimerranch.org/).

My name is Edward O'Toole and I live in one of the wildest, most beautiful parts of Europe, in the Carpathian Mountains of Eastern Slovakia. Life is an adventure - both physically and metaphysically... 

I've been living out here for the last 23 years, along with my wife, 3 kids and Jack Russell.
My main interests involve bushcraft, prepping, survival and wilderness living (self-sufficiency and self-reliance), ecological, green, smart and natural solutions, self-development and personal motivation, motorcycles and motorbike club life, writing and art (I have 7 published books), and exploring the paranormal.

For more about my lifestyle, art and writing visit http://www.edwardotoole.com

Outdoors is Always In Season... that's our motto at Hardy Brothers Outdoors.  The outdoors is therapeutic and a break from the hustle and bustle of our corporate jobs.  No project is too big and no lesson too small.  We don't shy away from the unknown, we tackle it, learn from it, and move to the next challenge.  

With over 175 acres in Southeastern Ohio where we are taking on conservation and habitat improvement projects and spending a significant amount of time outdoors learning and testing new approaches and products.  Our biggest and most exciting project is restoring over 80 acres of previously strip mined land back to native Ohio plants and forbs.  Known as the Habitat Oasis Project, we have now won 3 conservation awards from our local Soil and Water Conservation District, Pheasants Forever and Polaris.

Join our journey with you as we have fun and learn new things in the hills of Ohio!

Welcome to our Homestead Journey!
At our Oklahoma homestead, we're passionate about sharing our experiences and knowledge on all things homesteading. 

Our YouTube channel is the gateways to our world. We invite you to join us as we document our adventures and provide valuable insights into raising chickens, tending to our remarkable Highland cattle, cultivating bountiful gardens, mastering the art of building, and practicing sustainable land management techniques.
Follow our journey to stay up to date with the triumphs, challenges, and everything in between as we work diligently to create an exceptional homestead. We believe in the power of community and welcome you to become a part of ours.
Together, let's learn, grow, and build a remarkable homestead life. Join us on this extraordinary journey as we forge a sustainable future, one step at a time.

Welcome to our Homestead Journey. Let's make memories, cultivate knowledge, and build dreams together.

Freelance photographer since 1989, Eric Tourneret is today recognized internationally as ¬´the bee photographer¬ª. He presently lives in the Ard√®che region of France. 
When French beekeepers‚Äô efforts to have systemic insecticides prohibited alerted him to the disappearance of the bees, Eric began an in-depth work in 2004 on apiculture by immersing himself in the life of the hive. In 2007, he expanded his investigations on a worldwide scale with a series of features on the relation of humans to bees, from the most archaic harvesting methods to industrial and commercial beekeeping. 
Since then, Eric Tourneret has continued his travels, exploring the great beekeeping traditions in Slovenia, Germany and Turkey. He has encountered the nomads of Ethiopia and the Pygmies of the Republic of the Congo, the giant bees of India and Indonesia, the stingless bees of Brazil, Costa Rica and also the killer bees of Panama...

The International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) is an international financial institution and a United Nations specialized agency. IFAD invests in rural people, empowering them to reduce poverty, increase food security, improve nutrition and strengthen resilience.

We work with small-scale farmers, who grow one third of the world's food, to sustainably raise their productivity and incomes, help them to adapt to climate change, improve the quality of their lives and transform rural economies.
 
Two billion people work on small farms in developing countries. By 2050, these farmers will need to grow 60% more food for the 9.5 billion people on our planet.  With our support, rural people can take charge of their future.
 
Follow us to keep up to date with the challenges faced by people living in rural areas and the solutions that we come up with together. Watch their stories, hear about their struggles, and witness the change.

ECOKRAFT AG is a leading global company specializing in the development, manufacturing, and implementation of state-of-the-art pelleting plants and processes. Our primary objective is to prevent waste and recover valuable raw materials and energy sources. With our comprehensive range of cutting-edge technologies, we have the capabilities to seamlessly execute the entire pellet production process.

At ECOKRAFT, we specialize in transforming simple biomass and previously deemed non-recyclable materials into reusable and valuable resources for a wide range of applications, such as food production, energy generation, animal feed, animal bedding, and fertilizer.

Since our establishment in 2013, we have dedicated ourselves to tailoring pelleting systems that meet the unique requirements of our customers. Whether it's for small-scale operations with pelleting volumes of 150 kg/h or large-scale projects handling up to 4 t/h, we provide customized solutions to ensure optimal results.

nom_chaine: Roots So Deep (you can see the devil down there)
bio:
‚ÄúRoots So Deep (you can see the devil down there)‚Äù is a 4-part documentary series all about inventive farmers and maverick scientists building a path to soil health and farmer wealth with hooves, heart and soil.

Can an underutilized way to graze cattle, that mimics the way bison once roamed the land, help get farmers out of debt, restore our depleted soils, rebuild wildlife habitat and draw down huge amounts of carbon? Cattle have been seen as eco-villains for a long time. What if they can help save us from catastrophic climate change?

‚ÄúRoots So Deep‚Äù is guided by director and wrangler of scientists Peter Byck as he meets farmers on both sides of the fence ‚Äì the folks practicing an adaptive way to graze, and their neighbors set in their family‚Äôs generations-old method of doing things. Byck‚Äôs team of outcast scientists are measuring what‚Äôs happening on both sides of the fences ‚Äì exploring if this adaptive grazing could help slow down climate change.

Hager brand, with products ranging from energy distribution through cable management and wiring accessories to building automation and security systems, represents the core business of our company. FDA is responsible for advancing the public health by helping to speed innovations that make medical products more effective, safer, and more affordable and by helping the public get the accurate, science-based information they need to use medical products and foods to maintain and improve their health.

Hey y'all! Welcome to the farm! We are Miki (My-Key) & Bill. We are a new channel sharing our journey of homesteading life in South Carolina. 

From city life to farm life we are learning as we go and share our experiences on the farm ~ from raising livestock (cows, goats, pigs, chickens, turkeys & rabbits) to gardening & how to preserve our harvest by canning and food storage methods. 

From garden to table, we prepare some delicious homemade, southern style recipes. 

We are a DIY homestead, and we'll show you how to repurpose & reuse materials, do your own equipment repairs & maintenance, and share some DIY projects to save time and money. 

We enjoy this self-reliant and sustainable lifestyle. In today's tumultuous times, it's good to always be prepared and just get back to a simple way of life in the country the way our ancestors once lived.

Join us on our journey as we continue Celebrating FarmLife every day!

We are green living enthusiasts, we're committed to bring you to the ultimate destination for sustainable living solutions! 

Join our community of like-minded individuals dedicated to reducing our carbon footprint and creating a greener future. Through informative and engaging videos, we empower you with knowledge and inspire positive change. Explore a wide range of sustainable and eco-friendly living tips with us. Together, let's make a difference for a cleaner and more eco-friendly world!

bio:
La Cour des Aulnays is my little paradise, a 15th-16th century manor, that I do my best to renovate and make live again. With the help of friends we organise concerts, english teas, artistic residencies, workshops, and many other different events.
I live there alone, with my animal family made of 3 dogs, 7 cats, 3 goats, 3 sheep, 1 vietnamese pig, a hen, a rooster and a duckling. They are all free (just the goats are not allowed in the yard nor the vegetable garden, and the pig needs a fence when she is in heat) and friends, which makes quite a lot of funny and sweet scenes that I want to share with the world.

Our goal is teach how to be more self sufficient even on the smallest of acreage!  Gardening and homesteading on 1/2 acre in the Southern part of Utah where we raised our two children, grow our own organic food, raise chickens, dairy goats, ducks and turkeys.  On this small one half acre we have been able to become largely (80%) self sufficient, run a CSA, operate a small organic nursery and garden supply, and offer learning through the classes we teach here at our little farm.  We have 48 fruit trees, dozens of grape vines and berries, plus other edibles through the 1/2 acre. Our YouTube channel is devoted to share and teach our love for all these beautiful life skills that are being lost.  Join us on the journey!

You've arrived at the Simple Earth Survival Lab ‚Äì life at our outpost here in the Klein Karoo desert, South Africa. 

My videos document an organic & unplanned regimen of activities and events here. Nothing more.

Amidst the heat and the vast stretches of solitude, we build and work the very land that sustains us, the simplicity that grounds us, and the natural veld that guide us. Every day is a journey of self-reliance. From the sun-scorched afternoons spent tending to our goats and chickens, to the golden hours turning compost and planting vegetables, our hands are the tools that shape our world.

We build, dig, grow, graze, diy, farm goats, herd chickens, grow food, compost, harvest water, try to ignore the world's problems, and survive.

If you like it here, don't be shy to peek in at https://www.patreon.com/simple_earth - It's really the only compensation for the work on these videos.

#Survival #Construction #Permaculture #Livestock, #soilbuilding  #self-reliance

When I was 20 years old, I dropped out of college and said to myself that I will do what I really want and what I see the meaning in. So I decided to build my dream log cabin, all by myself.

Here I'm sharing my journey with you. Thank you all for your attention. Enjoy!

Sustainability Specialist | Content Creator | Founder of Off-Grid Farm

With over 10 years of experience in sustainability and off-grid living, I am committed to building a sustainable lifestyle focused on permaculture, renewable resources, and food autonomy. On my 7-hectare farm, I have developed innovative projects in natural construction, water management, animal care, and regenerative agriculture. I create educational and inspirational content, both video and written, to share the steps toward sustainable living with a vast community.

I am actively involved in various ecological and sustainable education initiatives, including the collection and composting of organic food waste and the promotion of regenerative farming. Additionally, I support schools and organizations in understanding the importance of permaculture and the impact of sustainable living through presentations and workshops.
